short_summary: Farming and fishing and forestry and wildlife Contracting Services
description: nutrient variability from environmental changes at Scotian Shelf
full_summary:
================================abeth Portfolio Tender Notice
http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14677666?extsite=MTQ2Nzc2NjZfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**Governance**
------------

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) has issued the Scotian Shelf Nutrient Study tender notice on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO).

**Overview and Objective**
-------------------------

The DFO is seeking a contractor to assess the environmental drivers of subsurface nutrient variability at the interannual and interdecadal scales on the Scotian Shelf. The primary objective is to understand how basin and regional-scale changes in Atlantic circulation and associated nutrient conditions are affecting the availability of surface nutrients available for phytoplankton production.

**Supporting Documentation**
---------------------------

Supporting documentation and bid submissions must be submitted by **2022-12-05, 14:00 EST**. Any bids submitted after this time will be declared non-responsive.

**Contract Information**
------------------------

*   **Solicitation Number**: WS3737226954
*   **Reference Number**: WS3737226954-DOC3749540978
*   **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
*   **End-User Entity**: Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO)

**Contact Information**
---------------------

To obtain further information or clarification on this tender notice, please contact:

Mariam Assal (SPAC/PSPC)
mariam.assal@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Classification**
-----------------

*   **Classification Code**: 70000000 - Farming, Fishing and Forestry and Wildlife Contracting Services
*   **Trade Agreement**: None

**Attachements**
---------------

None. Please refer to the Ariba Discovery posting response deadline for further details.

**Background**
-------------

This work will support the DFO's Species at Risk Program (SARP) Recovery Potential Assessment for the North Atlantic right whale. We will prioritize contractors that have expertise in assessing environmental drivers and nutrient variability at the mentioned scales. We also encourage collaboration and innovation in this area as part of this project. 

**End Date**: None was not found which might suggest open ended contract.
